juiceboxgallery.galleryTitle: Donald Glaser: From physics to biology and neuroscience

image.title: While at Caltech, Donald Glaser took classes with C.C. Lauritsen, I.S. Bowen, W.A. Fowler, and R.F. Christy, among others.

image.sourcePath: C:\Users\epiccio\Desktop\Glaser photogallery\Bianca\Glaser_Caltech and Beyond exhibit\jpg\4 Journal entry DAG_1_1_6_0001.jpg
image.title: Personal journal entry during Glaser’s period of work on the bubble chamber.
image.caption: March 24, 1958

image.caption: June 22, 1955

image.title: Bubble chamber tracks photo.
image.caption: Undated

image.sourcePath: C:\Users\epiccio\Desktop\Glaser photogallery\Bianca\Glaser_Caltech and Beyond exhibit\jpg\7 Bubble tracks photo 2 DAG_5_5_10_0007.jpg
image.title: Bubble chamber tracks photo.
image.caption: Undated

image.sourcePath: C:\Users\epiccio\Desktop\Glaser photogallery\Bianca\Glaser_Caltech and Beyond exhibit\jpg\8 DAG_5_5_11_0001.jpg
image.title: Song lyrics by Arthur Roberts inspired by the bubble chamber.
image.caption: November 1, 1958

image.sourcePath: C:\Users\epiccio\Desktop\Glaser photogallery\Bianca\Glaser_Caltech and Beyond exhibit\jpg\9 DAG_1_5_2_0006.jpg
image.title: An informal portrait of Donald Glaser taken during the Nobel celebrations.
image.caption: December 1960

image.sourcePath: C:\Users\epiccio\Desktop\Glaser photogallery\Bianca\Glaser_Caltech and Beyond exhibit\jpg\10 DAG_1_4_3_0001.jpg
image.title: Glaser’s Nobel lecture.
image.caption: December 1960

image.sourcePath: C:\Users\epiccio\Desktop\Glaser photogallery\Bianca\Glaser_Caltech and Beyond exhibit\jpg\11 DAG_1_5_3_0005.jpg
image.title: Glaser receiving the Nobel Prize from King Gustaf VI Adolf of Sweden.

image.sourcePath: C:\Users\epiccio\Desktop\Glaser photogallery\Bianca\Glaser_Caltech and Beyond exhibit\jpg\12 DAG_1_5_2_0015.jpg
image.title: The 1960 Nobel Prize winners.
image.caption: From left to right: Willard F. Libby, Chemistry; Peter Medawar, Physiology or Medicine; Sir Frank MacFarlane Burnet, Physiology or Medicine; Donald Glaser, Physics; Saint-John Perse, Literature.

image.sourcePath: C:\Users\epiccio\Desktop\Glaser photogallery\Bianca\Glaser_Caltech and Beyond exhibit\Glaser 3 nobelists.png
image.title: Excerpts from Donald Glaser and Carl Anderson's reflections about three generations of Nobel Prize winners.
image.caption: 1960 and 1981

image.sourcePath: C:\Users\epiccio\Desktop\Glaser photogallery\Bianca\Glaser_Caltech and Beyond exhibit\jpg\13 DAG_1_9_14_0010.jpg
image.title: Carl Anderson was Glaser’s doctoral advisor. Glaser spoke at Anderson’s memorial service.
image.caption: February 25, 1991

image.sourcePath: C:\Users\epiccio\Desktop\Glaser photogallery\Bianca\Glaser_Caltech and Beyond exhibit\jpg\14 DAG_1_9_14_0013.jpg
image.title: The first page of Glaser's speech for Anderson’s memorial service.
image.caption: February 25, 1991

image.sourcePath: C:\Users\epiccio\Desktop\Glaser photogallery\Bianca\Glaser_Caltech and Beyond exhibit\jpg\15 DAG_1_1_12_0001.jpg
image.title: After winning the Nobel Prize in physics, Glaser accepted an offer from MIT as visiting professor in Biophysics.

image.sourcePath: C:\Users\epiccio\Desktop\Glaser photogallery\Bianca\Glaser_Caltech and Beyond exhibit\jpg\16 DAG_1_1_7_0088.png
image.title: Glaser's notebooks during this time show a growing interest in biology.

image.sourcePath: C:\Users\epiccio\Desktop\Glaser photogallery\Bianca\Glaser_Caltech and Beyond exhibit\jpg\Qualitative analysis.png
image.title: Glaser's "Qualitative analysis" notebook reveals remarkable introspections.

image.sourcePath: C:\Users\epiccio\Desktop\Glaser photogallery\Bianca\Glaser_Caltech and Beyond exhibit\jpg\19 DAG_1_1_6_0004.png
image.title: An example of Glaser’s organizational and time management skills.

image.sourcePath: C:\Users\epiccio\Desktop\Glaser photogallery\Bianca\Glaser_Caltech and Beyond exhibit\jpg\23 DAG_6_3_9_0004.jpg
image.title: Glaser in his molecular biology lab.
image.caption: Undated

image.sourcePath: C:\Users\epiccio\Desktop\Glaser photogallery\Bianca\Glaser_Caltech and Beyond exhibit\jpg\24 DAG_6_3_9_0012.jpg
image.title: Glaser’s period in molecular biology included the design of the Cyclops, an automatic cell inoculator, and the Dumbwaiter, an automated system for growth and analysis of large numbers of bacterial colonies.

image.imageURL: images/25 DAG_1_1_10_0001 first page of whole folder.jpg
image.thumbURL: thumbs/25 DAG_1_1_10_0001 first page of whole folder.jpg
image.linkURL: images/25 DAG_1_1_10_0001 first page of whole folder.jpg
image.sourcePath: C:\Users\epiccio\Desktop\Glaser photogallery\Bianca\Glaser_Caltech and Beyond exhibit\jpg\25 DAG_1_1_10_0001 first page of whole folder.jpg
image.title: Notes on general scientific interests reveal Glaser’s motivations during his period in molecular biology.

image.sourcePath: C:\Users\epiccio\Desktop\Glaser photogallery\Bianca\Glaser_Caltech and Beyond exhibit\jpg\20 DAG_1_2_4_0008.jpg
image.title: Max Delbrück, 1969 Nobel Laureate in Physiology or Medicine, switched from theoretical physics to biology early in his career, as did Glaser. Delbrück hoped to “seduce more souls from physics” with Glaser’s help.

image.sourcePath: C:\Users\epiccio\Desktop\Glaser photogallery\Bianca\Glaser_Caltech and Beyond exhibit\jpg\22 DAG_1_8_7_0003.jpg
image.title: Caltech Alumni Distinguished Service Award awarded to Donald Glaser.

image.sourcePath: C:\Users\epiccio\Desktop\Glaser photogallery\Bianca\Glaser_Caltech and Beyond exhibit\jpg\21 DAG_1_8_7_0002.jpg
image.title: Prize motivation for the Caltech Alumni Distinguished Service Award.

image.sourcePath: C:\Users\epiccio\Desktop\Glaser photogallery\Bianca\Glaser_Caltech and Beyond exhibit\jpg\26 DAG_7_5_4_0017.jpg
image.title: In 1983, Donald Glaser switched his research to neuroscience. He focused on the visual system, also in relation to art and music.

image.sourcePath: C:\Users\epiccio\Desktop\Glaser photogallery\Bianca\Glaser_Caltech and Beyond exhibit\jpg\28 DAG_7_3_5_0030.jpg
image.title: Glaser's notes on illusions.

image.sourcePath: C:\Users\epiccio\Desktop\Glaser photogallery\Bianca\Glaser_Caltech and Beyond exhibit\jpg\27 DAG_7_6_12_0002.jpg
image.title: An Enigma figure, part of Glaser's work on neuroscience.
image.caption: Undated.

image.sourcePath: C:\Users\epiccio\Desktop\Glaser photogallery\Bianca\Glaser_Caltech and Beyond exhibit\jpg\29 DAG_1_9_13_0036.jpg
image.title: Donald Glaser was an Applemaster, part of a select group of creative visionaries in their chosen fields.

image.sourcePath: C:\Users\epiccio\Desktop\Glaser photogallery\Bianca\Glaser_Caltech and Beyond exhibit\jpg\30 DAG_1_9_13_0037.jpg
image.title: A group photo from Macworld.
image.caption: January 1998

image.sourcePath: C:\Users\epiccio\Desktop\Glaser photogallery\Bianca\Glaser_Caltech and Beyond exhibit\jpg\32 DAG_1_9_4_0080.jpg
image.title: Glaser and fellow Caltech theorist and 1969 Nobel Prize winner in Physics, Murray Gell-Mann, together at an Applemasters event.

image.sourcePath: C:\Users\epiccio\Desktop\Glaser photogallery\Bianca\Glaser_Caltech and Beyond exhibit\jpg\31 DAG_1_2_7_0015.jpg
image.title: Letter from Murray-Gell Mann to Donald Glaser's wife, Lynn, acknowledging Glaser's groundbreaking contributions to science.
image.caption: May 1, 2014
